ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Hot Key to Re-target Pet
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve remapped the following: target pet = del on keypad target nearest npc =  1 on keypad auto attack =  7 on keypad change view = + on
ygData.messageBody:
I've remapped the following:

"target pet" => "del" on keypad
"target nearest npc" = > "1" on keypad
"auto attack" = > "7" on keypad
"change view" => "+" on keypad

I essentially do the same as Tomerrlin, but I would find it hard to reach
the function keys while I'm twisting songs.
this way, my fingers stay on my "home keys" without me having to look at my
keyboard or stretch them too far.

---Windleaf

At 01:00 PM 6/28/00 -0400, Peck White wrote:
>Because I keep my left hand on the 1-6 hotkeys, I have remapped my target
>self/pet key to F7.
>
>Now I can easily:
>
>target mob 1
>hotkey 1(charm)
>F8
>hotkey 4 (pet attack(as below))
>F7,F7 (retarget pet)
>twist two songs (selo's (hotkey 2) or heal (hotkey 3))
>
>without moving either hand.
>
>Tomerrilin
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: blitz_krieg@... [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, June 28, 2000 12:46 PM
>To: eqbards@egroups.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Re: Hot Key to Re-target Pet
>
>Then I F1 twice, play heal song, and try to time the recharm
>exactly. :)
>
>To be able to program the F1/F1 would be tremendous, as in hectic
>situations I sometimes end up recharming the wrong mob. Pets (or
>tanks or nukers for that matter) don't seem to like that much. :)
>
